Title: Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k
Description:
Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k




Your Responsibilities:

Defining and implementing requirements for the design and operation of an XML database.
Conducting formal and content analysis of structured documents intended for storage in the database.
Developing and implementing validation routines and search functionalities within the database.
Supporting companies in standardization-related processes by delivering high-quality, efficient standards information.




Your Qualifications:

Completed degree in information science, documentation, computer science, IT, or a similar field.
Strong knowledge of database systems, architectures, and maintenance (NoSQL, SQL).
Baseline proficiency in programming: Java or Python.
Understanding of web services, service-oriented architectures, and associated technologies (HTML, HTTP, REST, JSON).
Very nice to have: XML technologies (XML, XPath, XSL, XQuery), but not essential.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a talent for developing innovative solutions.
Ability to collaborate across teams, combined with initiative and a results-oriented approach.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in both German and English.




What We Offer:

35-hour workweek (full-time).
Maxi-Flex option: Possibility to increase weekly hours to a maximum of 42 hours/week.
Flexible working hours
Remote working opportunities.
30 vacation days per year, plus company holidays between Christmas and New Year.
Centrally located offices
Access to onsite physiotherapy, subsidies for VBB company tickets, JobRad options, sabbatical opportunities, a subsidized company restaurant, company pension plans, and more.
Comprehensive onboarding, training, and ongoing support.

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer
Description:
Team

The Risk Controlling & Regulatory Reporting is a key function within the company that is responsible for generation of reports for regulatory and risk controlling purposes for Raisin.

To this extent, we build and maintain data pipelines using Snowflake, Looker, Airflow (MWAA) and dbt that process financial data and transform it. We then make these accessible to our regulatory and risk teams, who rely on this data to perform internal audits and report KPIs to regulatory authorities

Your Responsibilities


Work on and orchestrate scalable data pipelines to efficiently process and analyse large volumes of data, utilising Python, Snowflake, Airflow and dbt.
Collaborate with stakeholders to help translate their requirements into technical steps and coordinate the projects you drive with them.
Monitor and improve the health of our data pipelines.
Promote knowledge sharing within the team to foster collaboration and continuous learning
Stay updated on emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering and bring new ideas to enhance the technical set-up.
Maintain our CI/CD pipeline on Harness.


Your Profile


Solid experience with Airflow, Python programming and SQL / dbt.
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake is a plus.
Knowledge of AWS services and Docker is a plus.
Bachelors in Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant quantitative fields
Strong analytical and quantitative approach to problems
Familiarity with Data Engineering best practices, including Data Quality and Observability.
Comfortable working in a dynamic and changing environment, with a strong sense of responsibility.
Eagerness to learn and grow through on-the-job learning.


Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us!

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which, connects more than 40 different nationalities.

You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities.

As Part Of Our Team, You Will Benefit From


Employee Development Budget of €2,000 and four full training days per year.
Access to Babbel for continuous language learning.
Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office.
Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days.
Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than €20 per month.
Love cycling? With JobRad, lease the bike of your choice and enjoy tax savings, plus Raisin covers your monthly insurance costs.
A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%.
Do you miss being in the office? The Deutschland Ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with €25 per month.


About Us

Raisin is the trailblazer in the savings and investment space. Founded in 2012, the fintech company started by opening the $95+ trillion deposits and investments market of the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States to consumers.

Today, Raisin serves more than one million customers in these three markets, offering savings products as well as investment and pension products. This makes the Berlin-based fintech one of the leading global savings and investments marketplaces. Savers get a wider choice of attractive products with the ability to move their money freely. In addition, financial service providers get best-in-class marketplace solutions for their customers, and banks get better access to retail funding.

Raisin operates its own B2C marketplaces in Europe and the U.S. under the brands Raisin and WeltSparen. In Germany, the company offers ETF-based investment and retirement products in addition to savings products. Raisin works with over 400 banks and financial service providers from over 30 countries

We are backed by renowned international investors such as b2venture, Deutsche Bank, Goldman Sachs, Greycroft, Headline, Index Ventures, Latitude Ventures, Orange Ventures, PayPal Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Ribbit Capital, Vitruvian Partners and M&G.

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which connects more than 75 different nationalities.

In total, we have 7 offices across the world: Berlin, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Madrid, Manchester, Munich and New York.

We also think it’s important to take the time to celebrate our hard work and achievements together, with events like our yearly summer and winter party, as well as a couple of smaller get-togethers.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Möchtest du digitale Lösungen entwickeln, die den Journalismus auf das nächste Level bringen? In der Ströer Content Group Product & Tech arbeiten über 150 Expert:innen an innovativen Konzepten.

Unser Herzstück ist t-online.de, Deutschlands führende Nachrichten- und Ratgeberplattform. Mit einem einzigartigen Multiscreen-Konzept erreicht t-online millionen Nutzer:innen über alle digitalen Kanäle und setzt auf multimediales Storytelling, das sich an aktuellen Trends und Nutzer:innenverhalten orientiert.

Unsere Verticals wie Giga.de und kino.de ergänzen unser Angebot für die Generation Y. Wir schaffen Premium-Inhalte, die von Digital Natives konsumiert werden.

Denkst du kreativ und möchtest deine Ideen einbringen? Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft des digitalen Publishings!

Bei uns kannst Du mehr draus machen: Als Data Engineer (m/w/d) übernimmst Du eine Schlüsselrolle in der Entwicklung und Optimierung unserer datengetriebenen Prozesse. Du gestaltest innovative Lösungen für ETL/ELT, Datenpipelines und Machine-Learning-Modelle – und das in einer hochmodernen Cloud-Umgebung. Werde Teil unseres agilen Teams und bring Deine Expertise ein, um Datenströme effizienter und intelligenter zu machen.

Stellenbeschreibung


Du designst und entwickelst ETL-/ELT-Prozesse und sorgst für eine performante Datenverarbeitung und -analyse
Du baust und betreibst Datenpipelines, die Echtzeitdaten liefern und unterstützt Teams bei der Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Produkten (Personalisierung, Recommendations, Tracking)
Du entwickelst Schnittstellen zu externen Systemen und sorgst für eine zuverlässige Integration neuer Datenquellen (z. B. REST APIs, Google Analytics)
Du automatisierst Test- und Deployment-Prozesse von Datenmodellen, ETL-Jobs und Machine-Learning-Anwendungen
Du kümmerst dich um Infrastrukturkomponenten für Big Data und Streaming-Technologien (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und stellst deren hohe Verfügbarkeit und Effizienz sicher
Du verantwortest die Sicherstellung einer hohen Datenqualität und entwickelst Maßnahmen zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung der Systeme
Du arbeitest an der Entwicklung und Integration von Machine-Learning-Modellen zur Unterstützung unserer Personalisierungs- und Recommendation-Systeme
Du bist aktiver Teil unseres DevOps-Teams und übernimmst Verantwortung im Rahmen der Rufbereitschaft
Du dokumentierst technische Abläufe und sorgst für Transparenz und Nachvollziehbarkeit aller Datenprozesse


Qualifikationen


Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder im Bereich Schnittstellenentwicklung und Datenintegration
Fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL/ELT-Prozessen, SQL (PostgreSQL), NoSQL-Datenbanken sowie Workflow-Management (z. B. Airflow)
Umfangreiche Erfahrung im Umgang mit BigQuery, Google Analytics 4 (GA4) und Echtzeit-Tracking-Technologien
Kenntnisse im Bereich Big Data, Streaming (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und Personalisierungstechnologien
Erfahrung im Training und in der Produktivsetzung von Machine-Learning-Modellen
Erfahrung mit Infrastructure-as-Code (idealerweise Terraform) und sicherer Umgang mit Linux-Systemen
Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und Kommunikationsstärke
Zielorientierte Arbeitsweise, agiles Mindset und Freude an der Arbeit im Team


Zusätzliche Informationen


Feelgood: Ob frisches Obst & Müsli zum gemeinsamen Frühstück mit Blick auf die Speicherstadt am Standort Hamburg, Recreation Rooms in Frankfurt/Main & München, Lounge mit Playstation in Berlin - jeder Standort hat seinen eigenen Charme
Flexibility: Keine Lust auf Rush Hour? Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit auch aus dem Home Office zu arbeiten
Community: Wir übernehmen Verantwortung und sorgen für mehr Nachhaltigkeit und Diversität am Arbeitsplatz – engagiere Dich z.B. in unserer Nachhaltigkeitswerkstatt oder werde Mitglied in einer unserer Communities wie LGBTQ+ oder unserem Frauennetzwerk
Company: Sie oder Du? Bei uns findest Du ein kommunikatives und respektvolles Miteinander per „Du“ , das durch eine offene Kultur geprägt ist . Als Konzern legen wir besonderen Wert auf die berufliche Gleichstellung unserer Mitarbeiter:innen
Learn & Grow: Gestaltungsspielraum für Deine kreativen Ideen sowie fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten, z.B. in unserem internen Talenteprogramm, zeichnen die bunte Ströer-Welt aus
On Top: Profitiere durch unsere Benefits und nutze die Möglichkeit eines bezuschussten Mittagessens oder lease Dir vergünstigt ein Fahrrad und genieße exklusive Rabatte in vielen Shops
Show more
HTML:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Möchtest du digitale Lösungen entwickeln, die den Journalismus auf das nächste Level bringen? In der Ströer Content Group Product & Tech arbeiten über 150 Expert:innen an innovativen Konzepten.

Unser Herzstück ist t-online.de, Deutschlands führende Nachrichten- und Ratgeberplattform. Mit einem einzigartigen Multiscreen-Konzept erreicht t-online millionen Nutzer:innen über alle digitalen Kanäle und setzt auf multimediales Storytelling, das sich an aktuellen Trends und Nutzer:innenverhalten orientiert.

Unsere Verticals wie Giga.de und kino.de ergänzen unser Angebot für die Generation Y. Wir schaffen Premium-Inhalte, die von Digital Natives konsumiert werden.

Denkst du kreativ und möchtest deine Ideen einbringen? Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft des digitalen Publishings!

Bei uns kannst Du mehr draus machen: Als Data Engineer (m/w/d) übernimmst Du eine Schlüsselrolle in der Entwicklung und Optimierung unserer datengetriebenen Prozesse. Du gestaltest innovative Lösungen für ETL/ELT, Datenpipelines und Machine-Learning-Modelle – und das in einer hochmodernen Cloud-Umgebung. Werde Teil unseres agilen Teams und bring Deine Expertise ein, um Datenströme effizienter und intelligenter zu machen.

Stellenbeschreibung

  • Du designst und entwickelst ETL-/ELT-Prozesse und sorgst für eine performante Datenverarbeitung und -analyse
  • Du baust und betreibst Datenpipelines, die Echtzeitdaten liefern und unterstützt Teams bei der Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Produkten (Personalisierung, Recommendations, Tracking)
  • Du entwickelst Schnittstellen zu externen Systemen und sorgst für eine zuverlässige Integration neuer Datenquellen (z. B. REST APIs, Google Analytics)
  • Du automatisierst Test- und Deployment-Prozesse von Datenmodellen, ETL-Jobs und Machine-Learning-Anwendungen
  • Du kümmerst dich um Infrastrukturkomponenten für Big Data und Streaming-Technologien (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und stellst deren hohe Verfügbarkeit und Effizienz sicher
  • Du verantwortest die Sicherstellung einer hohen Datenqualität und entwickelst Maßnahmen zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung der Systeme
  • Du arbeitest an der Entwicklung und Integration von Machine-Learning-Modellen zur Unterstützung unserer Personalisierungs- und Recommendation-Systeme
  • Du bist aktiver Teil unseres DevOps-Teams und übernimmst Verantwortung im Rahmen der Rufbereitschaft
  • Du dokumentierst technische Abläufe und sorgst für Transparenz und Nachvollziehbarkeit aller Datenprozesse

Qualifikationen

  • Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder im Bereich Schnittstellenentwicklung und Datenintegration
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL/ELT-Prozessen, SQL (PostgreSQL), NoSQL-Datenbanken sowie Workflow-Management (z. B. Airflow)
  • Umfangreiche Erfahrung im Umgang mit BigQuery, Google Analytics 4 (GA4) und Echtzeit-Tracking-Technologien
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Big Data, Streaming (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und Personalisierungstechnologien
  • Erfahrung im Training und in der Produktivsetzung von Machine-Learning-Modellen
  • Erfahrung mit Infrastructure-as-Code (idealerweise Terraform) und sicherer Umgang mit Linux-Systemen
  • Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und Kommunikationsstärke
  • Zielorientierte Arbeitsweise, agiles Mindset und Freude an der Arbeit im Team

Zusätzliche Informationen

  • Feelgood: Ob frisches Obst & Müsli zum gemeinsamen Frühstück mit Blick auf die Speicherstadt am Standort Hamburg, Recreation Rooms in Frankfurt/Main & München, Lounge mit Playstation in Berlin - jeder Standort hat seinen eigenen Charme
  • Flexibility: Keine Lust auf Rush Hour? Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit auch aus dem Home Office zu arbeiten
  • Community: Wir übernehmen Verantwortung und sorgen für mehr Nachhaltigkeit und Diversität am Arbeitsplatz – engagiere Dich z.B. in unserer Nachhaltigkeitswerkstatt oder werde Mitglied in einer unserer Communities wie LGBTQ+ oder unserem Frauennetzwerk
  • Company: Sie oder Du? Bei uns findest Du ein kommunikatives und respektvolles Miteinander per „Du“ , das durch eine offene Kultur geprägt ist . Als Konzern legen wir besonderen Wert auf die berufliche Gleichstellung unserer Mitarbeiter:innen
  • Learn & Grow: Gestaltungsspielraum für Deine kreativen Ideen sowie fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten, z.B. in unserem internen Talenteprogramm, zeichnen die bunte Ströer-Welt aus
  • On Top: Profitiere durch unsere Benefits und nutze die Möglichkeit eines bezuschussten Mittagessens oder lease Dir vergünstigt ein Fahrrad und genieße exklusive Rabatte in vielen Shops

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Our Story




At think-cell, we create powerful software solutions that help professionals be more efficient and productive. Founded in 2002 and based in Berlin, our tools integrate seamlessly with Microsoft Office to help users create presentations, charts, and diagrams with ease. Our dynamic, international team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence.




How your role will look like:




You collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
You design and implement business logic, data models and visualizations by using various methods and technologies such as SQL, Python and BI tools
You contribute to a valuable, robust and performant data platform by e.g. optimizing code, debugging anomalies and writing documentation




You will be great for this position if you have

At least 8 years of working experience in a Data Analytics environment, ideally in a similar business (Online / eCommerce)
Strong general knowledge of “how to work with data”, e.g. statistical methods, data preparation & visualization, transfer from data via analyses into actionable insights
Advanced data analytics experience with using e.g. Python or R and very good SQL skills
Experience in data modelling and BI-Tool experience, ideally PowerBi and understanding of data architecture concepts
Experience in working with Google Analytics / Matomo data
Experience in Git
Solid understanding of tracking concepts (frontend/backend)
Solid A/B testing experience
Strong ability to work both independent and as a part of the team
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Well structured, detail-oriented working style with a passion for efficient documentation
Desire to succeed as a team by creating synergies over individual success
Capable of outlining and presenting complex issues in an easy-to-understand manner
Great understanding of eCommerce businesses (products & challenges)
Very good language skills in English and optionally also in German




Our Values




As part of our team, you will embody and help shape the following principles that define us:




Forward Thinking: We embrace change and challenge the status quo.
Ownership: We take pride in our work and learn from our mistakes.
Customer First: We prioritize delivering lasting value.
Unified Team: We foster collaboration, respect, and integrity.
Strive for Excellence: We set ambitious goals and pursue quality.




Why is think-cell the right place for you?




We empower over 1.2 million users across 30,000 companies, including top consulting firms and major global enterprises. With offices in Berlin, Denver, Boston, London, Tokyo, and Dubai, we’re a diverse team of over 150 people, committed to innovation and excellence.




Think-cell is more than a job – it's a chance to be part of an innovative, inclusive team that values collaboration and growth. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Together, we can shape the future of productivity software. We can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to the team!

Show more

Title: Marketing/Product Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




As a Data & Analytics Specialist (m/f/x) at Carhartt WIP, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our e-commerce teams. From leading analytics projects to managing BI systems and dashboards, you'll turn data into actionable insights that support business growth. This role requires a strong technical foundation, a deep understanding of the e-commerce landscape, and a proactive, hands-on mindset to drive meaningful impact across departments.




Your responsibilities:

Drive and execute analytics projects to support data-driven decision-making across e-commerce teams, including Paid Marketing, CRM, and Product.
Develop and analyze customer segments and audiences to drive personalized marketing, customer retention, and lifetime value.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and external service providers, including ERP and BI teams.
Own and manage BI systems used within e-commerce (i.e. Looker, Power BI, Google Analytics), ensuring scalability, usability, and data integrity.
Design, build, and maintain key performance dashboards that provide actionable insights for e-commerce stakeholders.
Support tracking implementation (i.e. Google Tag Manager, Firebase, Adjust) and define relevant KPIs to effectively monitor and optimize business performance.
Translate complex business questions into analytical approaches. Present insights to stakeholders and product owners, turning data into action and supporting customer strategy.
Promote a data-driven mindset within the team. Provide methodological guidance and mentorship to junior colleagues, contributing to team development and knowledge-sharing.




Your Profile:

Relevant experience leveraging customer data to answer business questions and drive targeting strategies, including advanced statistical analysis. Strong quantitative background with a degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong technical understanding of ERP systems, CommerceTools and data warehouse (DWH) architectures.
Deep knowledge of marketing and e-commerce analytics; hands-on experience working with tracking data (web and app) and integrating multiple data sources.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL) and visualization tools, e.g. Looker and Power BI.
Proven experience in a data-driven role within e-commerce or a similar digital environment.
Fast learner and problem solver; proactive, analytical, and solution-oriented team player.
Strong communicator with the ability to tell data stories and bridge commercial and technical perspectives; excellent written and spoken English; proficiency in German is an advantage.




Your Location:

Berlin / Germany

Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie's Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Science Analyst to join Billie's Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie's analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable working on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional skills, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


3-5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

  • Free German group classes

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Revenue Intelligence)
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

Identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the company’s growth and profitability.

Responsibilities


Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.



Job Requirements


Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
Proficiency in SQL.
Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and let’s create a success story together!
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over €1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

Identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the company’s growth and profitability.

Responsibilities

  • Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
  • Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
  • Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
  • Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
  • Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.


Job Requirements

  • Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
  • 2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
  • Proficiency in SQL.
  • Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
  • Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
  • Fluent English.


What do we offer?

  • Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
  • Fast growing international company with stable employment
  • Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
  • Mental Wellbeing Program – providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
  • Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
  • Free English and German language classes
  • Referral Program with attractive incentives
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid work


Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Do you think in data, recognize patterns where others only see numbers, and turn complex analyses into clear recommendations for action? Then you’ve come to the right place! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will take our data-driven decision-making to the next level with precise analyses and smart dashboards – creating real value for our company.







These tasks await you here:




Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to support essential decision-making processes
Analyze internal and external data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization
Ensure data integrity and guarantee that all BI tools provide reliable and accurate information
Define and implement KPI-driven success metrics to evaluate the performance of our business processes
Collaborate closely with various departments (Operations, Finance, Sales, Real Estate Management) to develop and enhance data-driven solutions
Support colleagues in effectively using BI tools and foster a data-driven mindset within the company




Your profile:




A degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role
Strong expertise in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboard development) and Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis tools, preferably macos)
Experience with SQL, APIs, ERP/CRM systems, ETL processes, and Data Warehousing is a plus – particularly in handling structured and unstructured data from diverse sources and integrating them into powerful BI systems
Knowledge of real estate market data and relevant KPIs is an advantage
Excellent English skills, ideally also German skills




This is what you can expect from us:




Learning Effects and Responsibility: A role with diverse tasks, a high degree of creative freedom, and ample opportunities for self-fulfillment
Teamwork & Diversity: Amazing team members you can rely on. We recognize the benefits of diverse teams and an inclusive corporate culture, which is why fostering diversity is a key part of our corporate strategy for the future
International Collaboration: Work alongside motivated colleagues in growing international teams
Personal Development: With a personalized development plan and continuous training, you’ll achieve your goals with us
Security: A permanent employment contract and a competitive salary package, including an annual bonus and regular salary adjustments
Leisure: 30 vacation days per year, plus additional special leave on December 24th and 31st
Fun and Benefits: Regular team events and workshops, as well as employee discounts
Show more

Title: Trainee Data Analytics (w/m/d)
Description:
Für unseren Geschäftsbereich Transformation suchen wir dich zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Trainee Data Analytics (w/m/d).
 

Das erwartet dich

Individualität – Mit einem für dich maßgeschneiderten sechsmonatigen Ausbildungsplan wirst du optimal auf das Berufsfeld des Business-Analytics-Beraters im SAP-Umfeld vorbereitet. Teil des Traineeprogramms werden z.B. fachliche und technologische Trainings, Schulungen und Arbeitsmethoden sein, welche mit einer SAP-Zertifizierung abschließen.

Analytics – Du leitest aus den Geschäftsprozessen die Anforderungen an die Business-Analytics-Lösungen ab und entwickelst ganzheitliche Anwendungen. Unsere Beratungsteams begleiten in allen Phasen der Projektrealisierung: Von der Anforderungs- und Bedarfsanalyse über die Erstellung betriebswirtschaftlicher Konzepte, bis zur Realisierung und Implementierung.

Beratungsfunktion – Wir beraten unsere Kunden in den Themen rund um SAP Business and Analytics, SAP Business Intelligence, SAP S/4HANA (Embedded Analytics) und SAP HANA Cloud.

Datenanalyse – Mit Werkzeugen aus den Bereichen Big Data, Predictive Analytics, Business AI, Cloud Computing, Business Analytics und Business Intelligence deckst du das gesamte Spektrum der Datenanalyse ab.

 

Das bringst du mit

 

Dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Ingenieurwesens, der Mathematik, der Statistik oder eines verwandten Fachbereichs hast du erfolgreich abgeschlossen oder stehst kurz davor.

Du bist begeistert davon, dich mit den Feldern Business and Analytics und Business AI auseinanderzusetzen und in diesem Umfeld Lösungen mit unseren Kunden zu entwickeln.

Idealerweise kannst du erste Erfahrungen in Form von Praktika oder Werkstundententätigkeiten im Bereich Business and Analytics oder Business AI vorweisen.

Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift bringst du mit.

Das Traineeprogramm startet zum 01.10.2025.

 

Deine Benefits

Flexibilität – Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die Möglichkeit, im Home Office sowie in über 40 Ländern zu arbeiten.

Masterförderung – Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. Darüber hinaus bieten wir die Möglichkeit einer Masterförderung für Examensmaster und Spezialisierungsmaster an.

Freizeit – Dank eines Teilzeit-Blockmodells kannst du auch mehrmonatige Auszeiten in Form eines Sabbaticals nehmen. Zusätzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland Überstunden auf einem persönlichen Jahresarbeitszeitskonto sammeln. Deine Überstunden kannst du im Laufe des Jahres durch Freizeit ausgleichen. Restliche Überstunden werden einmal jährlich ausgezahlt.

Gesundheit – Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von vergünstigten Beiträgen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

Das ist noch nicht alles – Wir möchten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten möglich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

 

 

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu lösen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Als Teil unseres Finance Transformation Teams unterstützt du Unternehmen dabei, ihre Finanzabteilung zu einem noch stärkeren Businesspartner zu machen und so die Wettbewerbsfähigkeit des gesamten Unternehmens schneller voranzutreiben. Dabei ist unser Themenspektrum breit: Von CFO-Strategie über Process Excellence, ERP-Systemen, Quality Assurance, Compliance und Data Management. Dabei stellen wir als integriertes Finance Transformation-Team das reibungslose Ineinandergreifen aller Teilprojekte entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette sicher.

 

Kontakt

Du hast Fragen zu dieser Position oder deiner Bewerbung?

Melde dich gerne bei Theresa Volders unter +49 1515 4092298.


Show more

Kontakt

Du hast Fragen zu dieser Position oder deiner Bewerbung?

Melde dich gerne bei Theresa Volders unter +49 1515 4092298.

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Mach Daten zur Entscheidungsgrundlage.




DINA entwickelt Technologien für funktionale und Cybersicherheit in Maschinen. Unsere Lösungen sorgen dafür, dass industrielle Systeme zuverlässig, sicher und zukunftsfähig bleiben.

Wir setzen auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen – aber da geht noch mehr. Mit deiner Expertise als Data Analyst (w/m/x) bringst du Struktur in unsere Kundendaten, entwickelst aussagekräftige Analysen und sorgst dafür, dass Daten zum integralen Bestandteil unserer Geschäftsstrategie werden.




Wir arbeiten in einer Holokratie – das bedeutet: keine starren Hierarchien, keine langen Entscheidungswege, sondern Verantwortung von Tag eins an. Wenn du gestalten willst, statt nur zu verwalten, bist du hier richtig.







Deine Aufgaben




Customer Journey Analytics: Du analysierst die gesamte Customer Journey – von Marketing über Sales bis zu Customer Success – und leitest daraus klare Handlungsempfehlungen ab.
Dashboards & Reporting: Du entwickelst Dashboards für Umsatzprognosen, Deal-Pipelines, Marketing-Performance und Kundenzufriedenheit.
Revenue Operations (RevOps): Deine Analysen helfen dabei, Prozesse zu optimieren und datenbasierte Geschäftsentscheidungen zu treffen.
Datenintegration & Engineering: Du optimierst die Anbindung und Nutzung unserer Daten aus CRM (HubSpot) und ERP (SAP Business One).
Preis- & Rabattanalysen: Du erkennst Muster, analysierst Rabattstrukturen und hilfst, die Preisstrategie zu optimieren.
Zukunftsperspektive: Du treibst das Thema Daten in der Organisation voran und hast die Möglichkeit, unser Data-Team mit aufzubauen.







Dein Profil




Analytische Stärke & Business-Sinn – Du verstehst, welche Zahlen wirklich relevant sind und wie man sie sinnvoll nutzt.
Kommerzielles Gespür – Du erkennst, welche datenbasierten Entscheidungen direkten Einfluss auf das Geschäft haben.
Visualisierung – Du bereitest Daten so auf, dass sie sofort verständlich und einprägsam sind.
Storytelling mit Daten – Du kannst aus Zahlen eine klare, überzeugende Geschichte machen, die Entscheidungen vorantreibt.
Eigenverantwortung & Proaktivität – Du wartest nicht auf Aufgaben, sondern siehst, was getan werden muss – und setzt es um.
Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse – 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung mit SQL, idealerweise ergänzt durch Tableau, Power BI oder Looker.
Technisches Verständnis – Du kannst mit APIs umgehen und hast Grundkenntnisse in der Datenintegration.
Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe – Du kannst mit Sales, Marketing und Management sprechen – und bringst deine Analysen auf den Punkt.







Das bekommst du von uns




Täglicher Team-Lunch – Dein Mittagessen geht auf uns.
Firmenfitness – Zugang zu Gympass, Wellpass oder Urban Sports.
Weiterbildung & Coaching – Dein Budget für Schulungen & Konferenzen.
Ausstattung nach Wahl – Laptop, Monitor & Headset nach deinen Bedürfnissen.
Mehr Eigenverantwortung – Entscheidungen treffen, statt auf Vorgaben warten.
Klare Rollen & Transparenz – Jeder weiß, wer wofür verantwortlich ist.
Gestaltungsspielraum – Deine Ideen bewegen etwas – in Prozessen, Strategie & Technologie.
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit – Arbeiten in Kreisen, nicht in Abteilungen.
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge – 40 € VWL + 25 € Zuschuss von uns.
Team-Workshops & Offsites – Zweimal im Jahr gemeinsame Strategie & Weiterentwicklung.
Flexibel & agil – Deine Rolle wächst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.




Show more

  • Flexibel & agil – Deine Rolle wächst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Almedia is an Ad-Tech company boosting leading brands to engage with broader audiences. Users can enjoy the latest games, apps, and products for rewards.

With our growing community of 35 million users since our launch in 2020, Almedia's Freecash.com is one of the fastest-growing platforms.

Our mission is to create a mutually rewarding experience, where users enjoy great content and advertisers achieve meaningful results.

Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst, where you'll ensure our data is clean, accessible, and ready for analysis. As a core member of our analytics team, you’ll ensure our data infrastructure effectively supports self-service analytics, insightful reporting, and business intelligence across the organization.Apply software engineering practices to analytics code, including version control, testing, and continuous integration.

What You’ll Do 🎯


Design, build, and maintain clean, scalable, and performance-optimized data models using SQL and dbt.
Automate and streamline data validation, testing, and reporting processes.
Take ownership of data analysis for a designated domain, collaborating closely with Product Analysts, Data Scientists, and Business Stakeholders to meet their analytical and reporting needs.
Proactively monitor data integrity, identify issues, and perform root cause analysis.
Maintain comprehensive data documentation and definitions for easy reference and understanding.
Train business users on utilizing the data platform and data visualization tools effectively.


What You’ll Bring 💡


Experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst, or similar role.
Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker to create insightful dashboards.
Strong experience in data engineering and analytics, with proficiency in Python and SQL.
Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and performance optimization.
Knowledge of data validation, testing frameworks, and version control best practices (Git).
Familiarity with modern data stacks (dbt, Snowflake/BigQuery/Redshift, Dagster/Airflow) and cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP).
Excellent communication skills for training and supporting business users.
Ability to maintain detailed data documentation and definitions.


What Makes You a Great Fit 🌟


Passionate about transforming data into actionable insights.
A detail-oriented problem-solver who excels in a collaborative environment.
Eager to innovate and continuously improve data processes.


Why Almedia is your next Big Opportunity? 🚀


Become an owner: As part of our virtual equity option policy, you’ll have the opportunity to share in Almedia’s success and growth.
Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.


We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth—whether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
Show more

Our mission is to create a mutually rewarding experience, where users enjoy great content and advertisers achieve meaningful results.

Join our team as a Senior Data Analyst, where you'll ensure our data is clean, accessible, and ready for analysis. As a core member of our analytics team, you’ll ensure our data infrastructure effectively supports self-service analytics, insightful reporting, and business intelligence across the organization.Apply software engineering practices to analytics code, including version control, testing, and continuous integration.

What You’ll Do 🎯

  • Design, build, and maintain clean, scalable, and performance-optimized data models using SQL and dbt.
  • Automate and streamline data validation, testing, and reporting processes.
  • Take ownership of data analysis for a designated domain, collaborating closely with Product Analysts, Data Scientists, and Business Stakeholders to meet their analytical and reporting needs.
  • Proactively monitor data integrity, identify issues, and perform root cause analysis.
  • Maintain comprehensive data documentation and definitions for easy reference and understanding.
  • Train business users on utilizing the data platform and data visualization tools effectively.

What You’ll Bring 💡

  • Experience as an Analytics Engineer, Data Analyst, or similar role.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker to create insightful dashboards.
  • Strong experience in data engineering and analytics, with proficiency in Python and SQL.
  • Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts, data modeling, and performance optimization.
  • Knowledge of data validation, testing frameworks, and version control best practices (Git).
  • Familiarity with modern data stacks (dbt, Snowflake/BigQuery/Redshift, Dagster/Airflow) and cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP).
  • Excellent communication skills for training and supporting business users.
  • Ability to maintain detailed data documentation and definitions.

What Makes You a Great Fit 🌟

  • Passionate about transforming data into actionable insights.
  • A detail-oriented problem-solver who excels in a collaborative environment.
  • Eager to innovate and continuously improve data processes.

Why Almedia is your next Big Opportunity? 🚀

  • Become an owner: As part of our virtual equity option policy, you’ll have the opportunity to share in Almedia’s success and growth.
  • Innovative and high-growth: Join a startup that has been profitable from day one and is rapidly scaling its impact in the Ad-Tech space.
  • Collaborative and inclusive culture: Be part of a fast-paced, motivated team of professionals that values feedback and where your contributions truly matter. We embrace diversity and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply.
  • Berlin office & flexibility: Work in our modern, centrally located space with an office-first culture, while enjoying flexibility when needed, including a work-from-abroad policy to support your personal and professional life balance.

We believe in fostering talent, evaluating all skill levels during the hiring process, and providing a clear path for growth—whether you aspire to be a future leader or a specialist. Almedia is an equal opportunity employer; we embrace and celebrate diversity, encouraging individuals from all backgrounds to apply.

Title: Senior Applied Statistician
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 160 employees across more than 30 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

We are looking for an in-house Senior Applied Statistician to assist our Programme and Data teams. Across both, we are looking to better understand and explain our data in order to bolster our scientific rigour. You will sit between both teams and should be confident working with different types of statistical analysis, process-based modelling, and sampling/stratification.

Equally, you should have a good understanding of statistical modelling and bring a fresh perspective to our machine learning and process-based approaches. Thus, you will be a strong communicator capable of translating complex analysis into simplified insights to both internal and external stakeholders.

The Programme and Data teams are integral to the scientific operations of the company, and you will work closely together with them and our Product teams to ensure state of the art science drives our world leading carbon platform. As such, you will be part of a dynamic and high-paced work environment constantly subject to innovation.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Estimating uncertainty and error propagation in our models;
  • Applying Bayesian methods for the calibration of complex process-based models;
  • Designing sampling strategies for our data collection campaigns;
  • Evaluating the quality and quantity of our data;
  • Communicating and visualising key insights;

Who We’re Looking For

  • Self-driven individual capable of collaborating in a multi-disciplinary environment;
  • Minimum Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, or appropriate science/engineering field;
  • 3+ years of experience working in a relevant field, with experience in some or all of the following:
  • Experience translating statistical models from notation form (e.g. research papers) into clean re-usable code
  • Working with temporal and spatial data;
  • Experience coding in R;
  • Handling unstructured and messy data.
  • Strong scientific writing, report creation and communication skills to audiences with a range of technical expertise.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Masters or PhD in one of the relevant Science fields mentioned above;
  • A baseline understanding of greenhouse gas accounting frameworks and methodologies;
  • Strong theoretical background in Bayesian Statistics;
  • Knowledge or experience working with crop, pedometrics, or process-based models;
  • Experience coding in Python;

What’s In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Centrally located modern office in Copenhagen or London and the option to work from home a couple days a week;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Als BI Analyst (m/w/d) im Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team bist du maßgeblich dafür verantwortlich, datengetriebene Insights für unsere Marketing-, Service- und Vertriebsaktivitäten zu generieren und aufzubereiten. Durch die Aggregation, Analyse und Visualisierung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen trägst du entscheidend zur Optimierung unserer Customer Journey, der Effizienz unserer Marketing- und Lead-Generierungskampagnen, der Call Center Management Prozesse und der strategischen Entscheidungsfindung bei.

Was du bewirkst


Durchführung von Analysen der Customer Journey anhand der Global Digital Marketing Daten, um Trends zu identifizieren und Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten
Entwicklung, Pflege und Optimierung von Dashboards und Reportings in Power BI und Google Sheets zur Visualisierung und Überwachung von KPIs
Automatisierung und Optimierung von Datenprozessen und Sicherstellung der Datenqualität durch den Einsatz von Python, SQL und Databricks
Unterstützung des zentralen sowie globalen Marketings bei der Planung, dem Forecasting und dem unterjährigen Monitoring ihrer Ziel-KPIs
Erstellung länderspezifischer Analysen, um Wachstum zu generieren und die Nutzung der digitalen Marketingkanäle in den einzelnen Märkten zu optimieren
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Data Engineering und Data Science Teams innerhalb der Viessmann IT
Aufbereitung von Ergebnissen in Form von Präsentationen, Reports und Zusammenfassungen für relevante Stakeholder


Das bist du


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, BWL, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, CRM oder in einem vergleichbaren analytischen Bereich
Sehr gute analytische Fähigkeiten sowie Kenntnisse in Statistik und Data Modeling
Fundierte Erfahrung mit Tools wie Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks und idealerweise auch mit Python, SQL oder ähnlichen Technologien
Erfahrung bei der Analyse von CRM, Call Center und/oder Performance Marketing Daten
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten verständlich und wirkungsvoll aufzubereiten und zu präsentieren
Selbstständige, strukturierte Arbeitsweise und Freude an der Arbeit in einem internationalen, cross-funktionalen Team
Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch (mind. Level B2)


Auch wenn du nicht alle Punkte erfüllst, aber bereit für die Herausforderung bist, dann klicke trotzdem auf "Bewerben". Wir lieben deinen Spirit!

Das macht uns besonders

Unsere Mitarbeiter:innen sind der Schlüssel dazu, unsere Vision zum Leben zu erwecken. Basierend auf dieser Überzeugung haben wir Benefits für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen geschaffen:


Dich erwartet eine Festanstellung in einem erfolgreichen Unternehmen, in dem neue Technologien auf eine moderne Arbeitsplatzkultur treffen.
Bei Viessmann Climate Solutions bekommst du 30 Tage bezahlten Urlaub im Jahr.
Du hast als Mitarbeiter:in erfolgreich eine neue Kollegin oder einen Kollegen geworben? Als Dankeschön bekommst du eine Empfehlungsprämie.
Genieße unsere großartigen Exklusiv-Rabatte auf ausgewählte Viessmann Climate Solutions Produkte und Dienstleistungen.
Kleiner Energiekick zwischendurch gefällig? Bei uns stehen kostenlose gesunde Snacks und Getränke für dich bereit.
Für ein gesundes Miteinander: Unser Gesundheitsprogramm bietet einfachen Zugang zu Coachings und Therapie für unsere Mitarbeitenden und deren Familien.
Ob mit Job Bike oder mit Europcar – unsere Partnerschaften schonen gleichzeitig die Umwelt und deinen Geldbeutel.
Unsere Viessmann Akademie und externen Partner bieten zahlreiche fachliche und persönliche Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten an.
Viessmann bietet dir, wann immer möglich, die Option zum mobilen Arbeiten und sorgt für die passende technische Ausstattung.
Bei uns kommt der Spaß nicht zu kurz, denn bei Viessmann freuen wir uns auf gemeinsame Events, wie unser monatliches Frühstück oder andere Teamevents.
Unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten ermöglichen es dir, Arbeit und Privatleben miteinander zu vereinbaren.
Kita oder Schule zu? Kein Problem! In unserem Eltern-Kind-Raum hat dein Nachwuchs ausreichend Platz und Spielzeuge und du hast einen voll ausgestatteten Arbeitsplatz.


Das sind wir

Wir sind Viessmann Climate Solutions. 1917 als Heiztechnik-Hersteller gegründet, sind wir heute, als Teil von Carrier, ein weltweit führender Anbieter für effiziente und systemische Klima- und erneuerbare Energielösungen für den Wohn- und Gewerbesektor. Wir decken alle Anwendungen ab: Heizen, Kühlen, Lüften, Wasser- und Luftqualität, Energieerzeugung und Energiespeicherung für den Wohn- und Gebäudesektor.

Unser integriertes Lösungsangebot verbindet Produkte und Systeme über digitale Plattformen und Dienstleistungen nahtlos zu einer ganzheitlichen Klima- und Energielösung und schafft so ein sicheres und verlässliches Wohlfühlklima für unsere Nutzer:innen. Alle Aktivitäten basieren auf unserem Unternehmensleitbild „Wir gestalten Lebensräume für zukünftige Generationen‟ und unsere Mitarbeiter:innen spielen dabei mit Leidenschaft eine aktive Rolle bei der Energiewende. Sei ein Teil von dieser spannenden Reise.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.
