Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Intern (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.​

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. ​ Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Show more
HTML:
Who We Are


Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.


What You Will Do


As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

  • Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
  • Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
  • Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
  • Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
  • Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
  • Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
  • Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company


Why Join Us?


Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!


Who Can Apply?


  • Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
  • Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
  • Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
  • Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
  • Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
  • Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus


How to Apply?


To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.​

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. ​ Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.


What to expect during the interviews process?


At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html


Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.


Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.


Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst – Central Reporting (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description


Strategic Partnership: Collaborate with the VP of Financial BI, VP of FP&A, and C-Suite leadership to align business intelligence strategies with financial goals. Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Finance to deliver data-driven insights that support business growth and operational efficiency.
Project Ownership: Manage the intake and prioritization of data projects, ensuring clear goals, scope, and expected impact. Work with stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize initiatives, and drive execution in alignment with business objectives.
End-to-End Data Solutions: Own the full lifecycle of data solutions, from scoping and MVP development to data modeling, implementation, and validation. Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business leaders to ensure solutions are scalable and fit-for-purpose.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding: Develop effective, actionable dashboards and data products that translate complex data into clear, intuitive insights. Apply best practices in data visualization to communicate key information effectively across all levels, from operational teams to executive leadership.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Conduct ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data work to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide proactive recommendations that drive business performance and ensure ongoing monitoring of key metrics.
Enhancing Data Culture: Elevate analytical standards and best practices within the organization. Share knowledge, refine methodologies, and stay up to date with the latest BI, data visualization, and analytics trends.



Qualifications


5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels



Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company
Description:
Zertificon builds email encryption software that businesses trust and love to use. Our software protects millions of emails every day across businesses and industries that are part of your personal life too, like healthcare, retail, banking, and government. So, it's pretty likely that our products are already doing their bit to keep your personal information safe. With 20 years of expertise in cryptography, Zertificon is a recognized name in IT security. We’re proud to be independent and owner-operated, with a diverse team of 100 people from 20 nationalities, all working together to make digital business communication safer.




We believe in what we do. Every day our products make this world a safer place. With that our work has a Meaning, and this is very important to us. Freedom of communication is our core value, and that is the reason that we donate to Edward Snowden charity organization each time when an applicant mentions his name in the application and then is hired and passes the probation period by us.

We are burning for making the world a safer place. This needs security that actually works and is not bypassed for convenience. The key is automation and usability where people need to get involved. So we deliver this cyber security that is not limited to specialists and big companies. For security that cannot be easily compromized, not even by governments. Our products are scalable internationally and are truly user-friendly. We want to make cyber security available to everyone. And ease of use is the key, otherwise it won't be used.




Do you feel addressed? We are looking forward to hearing from you. And yeah, if you mention "I value what you value" within your application, we will know, what you mean:)




Data Analyst (m/f/d) in IT security company




What you would do:




Experience with Docker and Git is essential for this role. We are seeking a candidate who is comfortable working in Docker environments, skilled in version control systems, and possesses strong Python programming abilities beyond basic libraries like Pandas.




You'll collaborate directly with our Senior Data Scientist, helping turn raw data into insights and targets that drive our business goals.




Ensure data integrity, process, clean, and verify data for accurate analysis
Perform exploratory analysis, build and maintain data processing pipelines from multiple sources using SQL and Python
Build automated dashboards and improve reporting logic to help senior leadership make better decisions







What this job requires:




4+ years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Data Science, Business Intelligence or comparable fields
Profound experience with programming languages such as Python, SQL and Shell Script
Strong knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, JSON, MongoDB)
Familiarity with ELK Stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana)
Experience with Git and Docker




Don't meet every requirement? We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested. We want to get to know you.

Please note, that we can accept only PDF as attachments to the application. Other formats will not be screened. Thank you for your understanding.




What Zertificon offers you




Flexible working hours and home office possible
Mobility: free Germany ticket, job bike leasing or car parking
Allowances for food (e.g. Lieferando) and internet in the home office
Benefits in the office: Roof terraces & green courtyard, organic fruit and drinks, parcel acceptance
Get-together: pizza Friday in the office, regular team events, big summer party
Responsible leadership: onboarding, regular feedback meetings and transparent quarterly targets
Innovative without start-up risk: We are independent of investors and our business model has been profitable since 2004 – but we are not resting on our laurels and continue to pursue big plans
Meaningful work in IT security and the opportunity to work on the major challenges of our time
Great market potential worldwide




Want to know more? Please have a look at our Work at Zertificon page: https://www.zertificon.com/en/it-jobs-berlin/work-at-zertificon







Questions?

You can reach our HR team at

+49 30 5900 300-44

jobs@zertificon.com

Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie's Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Science Analyst to join Billie's Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie's analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable working on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional skills, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


3-5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k
Description:
Junior Data Engineer- Berlin - 60k




Your Responsibilities:

Defining and implementing requirements for the design and operation of an XML database.
Conducting formal and content analysis of structured documents intended for storage in the database.
Developing and implementing validation routines and search functionalities within the database.
Supporting companies in standardization-related processes by delivering high-quality, efficient standards information.




Your Qualifications:

Completed degree in information science, documentation, computer science, IT, or a similar field.
Strong knowledge of database systems, architectures, and maintenance (NoSQL, SQL).
Baseline proficiency in programming: Java or Python.
Understanding of web services, service-oriented architectures, and associated technologies (HTML, HTTP, REST, JSON).
Very nice to have: XML technologies (XML, XPath, XSL, XQuery), but not essential.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a talent for developing innovative solutions.
Ability to collaborate across teams, combined with initiative and a results-oriented approach.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in both German and English.




What We Offer:

35-hour workweek (full-time).
Maxi-Flex option: Possibility to increase weekly hours to a maximum of 42 hours/week.
Flexible working hours
Remote working opportunities.
30 vacation days per year, plus company holidays between Christmas and New Year.
Centrally located offices
Access to onsite physiotherapy, subsidies for VBB company tickets, JobRad options, sabbatical opportunities, a subsidized company restaurant, company pension plans, and more.
Comprehensive onboarding, training, and ongoing support.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero’s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how we should prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor Management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, Digital Sales, Sales Enablement)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient using orchestration tools (preferably DBT + Airflow)
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Proficient in at least one Visualisation tool (preferably Tableau)
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Ability to correctly present findings to senior stakeholders
Critical thinking and Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Marketing/Product Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




As a Data & Analytics Specialist (m/f/x) at Carhartt WIP, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our e-commerce teams. From leading analytics projects to managing BI systems and dashboards, you'll turn data into actionable insights that support business growth. This role requires a strong technical foundation, a deep understanding of the e-commerce landscape, and a proactive, hands-on mindset to drive meaningful impact across departments.




Your responsibilities:

Drive and execute analytics projects to support data-driven decision-making across e-commerce teams, including Paid Marketing, CRM, and Product.
Develop and analyze customer segments and audiences to drive personalized marketing, customer retention, and lifetime value.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and external service providers, including ERP and BI teams.
Own and manage BI systems used within e-commerce (i.e. Looker, Power BI, Google Analytics), ensuring scalability, usability, and data integrity.
Design, build, and maintain key performance dashboards that provide actionable insights for e-commerce stakeholders.
Support tracking implementation (i.e. Google Tag Manager, Firebase, Adjust) and define relevant KPIs to effectively monitor and optimize business performance.
Translate complex business questions into analytical approaches. Present insights to stakeholders and product owners, turning data into action and supporting customer strategy.
Promote a data-driven mindset within the team. Provide methodological guidance and mentorship to junior colleagues, contributing to team development and knowledge-sharing.




Your Profile:

Relevant experience leveraging customer data to answer business questions and drive targeting strategies, including advanced statistical analysis. Strong quantitative background with a degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong technical understanding of ERP systems, CommerceTools and data warehouse (DWH) architectures.
Deep knowledge of marketing and e-commerce analytics; hands-on experience working with tracking data (web and app) and integrating multiple data sources.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL) and visualization tools, e.g. Looker and Power BI.
Proven experience in a data-driven role within e-commerce or a similar digital environment.
Fast learner and problem solver; proactive, analytical, and solution-oriented team player.
Strong communicator with the ability to tell data stories and bridge commercial and technical perspectives; excellent written and spoken English; proficiency in German is an advantage.




Your Location:

Berlin / Germany

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Our Story




At think-cell, we create powerful software solutions that help professionals be more efficient and productive. Founded in 2002 and based in Berlin, our tools integrate seamlessly with Microsoft Office to help users create presentations, charts, and diagrams with ease. Our dynamic, international team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence.




How your role will look like:




You collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
You design and implement business logic, data models and visualizations by using various methods and technologies such as SQL, Python and BI tools
You contribute to a valuable, robust and performant data platform by e.g. optimizing code, debugging anomalies and writing documentation




You will be great for this position if you have

At least 8 years of working experience in a Data Analytics environment, ideally in a similar business (Online / eCommerce)
Strong general knowledge of “how to work with data”, e.g. statistical methods, data preparation & visualization, transfer from data via analyses into actionable insights
Advanced data analytics experience with using e.g. Python or R and very good SQL skills
Experience in data modelling and BI-Tool experience, ideally PowerBi and understanding of data architecture concepts
Experience in working with Google Analytics / Matomo data
Experience in Git
Solid understanding of tracking concepts (frontend/backend)
Solid A/B testing experience
Strong ability to work both independent and as a part of the team
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Well structured, detail-oriented working style with a passion for efficient documentation
Desire to succeed as a team by creating synergies over individual success
Capable of outlining and presenting complex issues in an easy-to-understand manner
Great understanding of eCommerce businesses (products & challenges)
Very good language skills in English and optionally also in German




Our Values




As part of our team, you will embody and help shape the following principles that define us:




Forward Thinking: We embrace change and challenge the status quo.
Ownership: We take pride in our work and learn from our mistakes.
Customer First: We prioritize delivering lasting value.
Unified Team: We foster collaboration, respect, and integrity.
Strive for Excellence: We set ambitious goals and pursue quality.




Why is think-cell the right place for you?




We empower over 1.2 million users across 30,000 companies, including top consulting firms and major global enterprises. With offices in Berlin, Denver, Boston, London, Tokyo, and Dubai, we’re a diverse team of over 150 people, committed to innovation and excellence.




Think-cell is more than a job – it's a chance to be part of an innovative, inclusive team that values collaboration and growth. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Together, we can shape the future of productivity software. We can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to the team!

Title: Product Analyst, Seamless - (Logistics)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for an experienced Product Analyst - Logistics (all genders) to join the Customer Product Line, Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. The role is for Seamless domain in the Customer Product Line. In the Seamless Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, work closely with the product, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the “data-first” mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-7 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and Backend Engineers and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests


In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

What you need to be successful


2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
Good English communication skills
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

  • Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
  • Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
  • Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
  • Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
  • Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
  • Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
  • Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
  • Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests

In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

What you need to be successful

  • 2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
  • Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
  • Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
  • Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
  • You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
  • Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
  • Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
  • Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
  • Good English communication skills
  • Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
  • Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
  • Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
  • Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow

Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.

Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Möchtest du digitale Lösungen entwickeln, die den Journalismus auf das nächste Level bringen? In der Ströer Content Group Product & Tech arbeiten über 150 Expert:innen an innovativen Konzepten.

Unser Herzstück ist t-online.de, Deutschlands führende Nachrichten- und Ratgeberplattform. Mit einem einzigartigen Multiscreen-Konzept erreicht t-online millionen Nutzer:innen über alle digitalen Kanäle und setzt auf multimediales Storytelling, das sich an aktuellen Trends und Nutzer:innenverhalten orientiert.

Unsere Verticals wie Giga.de und kino.de ergänzen unser Angebot für die Generation Y. Wir schaffen Premium-Inhalte, die von Digital Natives konsumiert werden.

Denkst du kreativ und möchtest deine Ideen einbringen? Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft des digitalen Publishings!

Bei uns kannst Du mehr draus machen: Als Data Engineer (m/w/d) übernimmst Du eine Schlüsselrolle in der Entwicklung und Optimierung unserer datengetriebenen Prozesse. Du gestaltest innovative Lösungen für ETL/ELT, Datenpipelines und Machine-Learning-Modelle – und das in einer hochmodernen Cloud-Umgebung. Werde Teil unseres agilen Teams und bring Deine Expertise ein, um Datenströme effizienter und intelligenter zu machen.

Stellenbeschreibung


Du designst und entwickelst ETL-/ELT-Prozesse und sorgst für eine performante Datenverarbeitung und -analyse
Du baust und betreibst Datenpipelines, die Echtzeitdaten liefern und unterstützt Teams bei der Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Produkten (Personalisierung, Recommendations, Tracking)
Du entwickelst Schnittstellen zu externen Systemen und sorgst für eine zuverlässige Integration neuer Datenquellen (z. B. REST APIs, Google Analytics)
Du automatisierst Test- und Deployment-Prozesse von Datenmodellen, ETL-Jobs und Machine-Learning-Anwendungen
Du kümmerst dich um Infrastrukturkomponenten für Big Data und Streaming-Technologien (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und stellst deren hohe Verfügbarkeit und Effizienz sicher
Du verantwortest die Sicherstellung einer hohen Datenqualität und entwickelst Maßnahmen zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung der Systeme
Du arbeitest an der Entwicklung und Integration von Machine-Learning-Modellen zur Unterstützung unserer Personalisierungs- und Recommendation-Systeme
Du bist aktiver Teil unseres DevOps-Teams und übernimmst Verantwortung im Rahmen der Rufbereitschaft
Du dokumentierst technische Abläufe und sorgst für Transparenz und Nachvollziehbarkeit aller Datenprozesse


Qualifikationen


Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder im Bereich Schnittstellenentwicklung und Datenintegration
Fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL/ELT-Prozessen, SQL (PostgreSQL), NoSQL-Datenbanken sowie Workflow-Management (z. B. Airflow)
Umfangreiche Erfahrung im Umgang mit BigQuery, Google Analytics 4 (GA4) und Echtzeit-Tracking-Technologien
Kenntnisse im Bereich Big Data, Streaming (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und Personalisierungstechnologien
Erfahrung im Training und in der Produktivsetzung von Machine-Learning-Modellen
Erfahrung mit Infrastructure-as-Code (idealerweise Terraform) und sicherer Umgang mit Linux-Systemen
Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und Kommunikationsstärke
Zielorientierte Arbeitsweise, agiles Mindset und Freude an der Arbeit im Team


Zusätzliche Informationen


Feelgood: Ob frisches Obst & Müsli zum gemeinsamen Frühstück mit Blick auf die Speicherstadt am Standort Hamburg, Recreation Rooms in Frankfurt/Main & München, Lounge mit Playstation in Berlin - jeder Standort hat seinen eigenen Charme
Flexibility: Keine Lust auf Rush Hour? Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit auch aus dem Home Office zu arbeiten
Community: Wir übernehmen Verantwortung und sorgen für mehr Nachhaltigkeit und Diversität am Arbeitsplatz – engagiere Dich z.B. in unserer Nachhaltigkeitswerkstatt oder werde Mitglied in einer unserer Communities wie LGBTQ+ oder unserem Frauennetzwerk
Company: Sie oder Du? Bei uns findest Du ein kommunikatives und respektvolles Miteinander per „Du“ , das durch eine offene Kultur geprägt ist . Als Konzern legen wir besonderen Wert auf die berufliche Gleichstellung unserer Mitarbeiter:innen
Learn & Grow: Gestaltungsspielraum für Deine kreativen Ideen sowie fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten, z.B. in unserem internen Talenteprogramm, zeichnen die bunte Ströer-Welt aus
On Top: Profitiere durch unsere Benefits und nutze die Möglichkeit eines bezuschussten Mittagessens oder lease Dir vergünstigt ein Fahrrad und genieße exklusive Rabatte in vielen Shops

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Introduction

Main Responsibilities

The Data Analyst is a key role in our journey to becoming a data driven organisation. This is a key operational role, which supports the CIO and Head of Data (Framework Owner) responsibilities for development, implementation and day-to-day operation of Data Management Frameworks. Specifically, this involves activities related to metadata management, data harmonisation, data quality score carding, data quality issue analysis, data profiling and data lineage; thereby establishing data governance and ongoing maturity of the Bank's prioritised business outputs.

This role provides fundamental support and guidance for Information Area Owners and data stewards, as well as project teams to translate their data requirements (aligned to data policy and frameworks) into data outcomes using technical (profiling, mining, score carding) and business analysis skills. Ongoing impact is being made through the data analyst skillset where the ability to study, analyse and interpret large volumes of transactional data, question authenticity as well as construct solutions, work arounds and technical thinking, showcases the way forward for a more mature and holistic data service.

The role reports directly to the Data Technical Lead and is part of a team of data analysts responsible for embedding best practice data governance and quality practices across the Bank whilst also helping support the wider change initiatives across the organisation.


Analytical problem solving with regards to analysing complex data sets and extracting meaningful insights for data quality management.
Quantitative proficiency in order to work across multiple data sets and information areas.
Problem solving skills related to data profiling analysis, score carding and error detection.
Detailed scrutiny of data transformations and Data lineage in order to operationalise the Ab Initio system.
Undertake activities to support the enterprise-wide data catalogue, to document business glossary definitions, taxonomies, ontologies and alignment to Handelsbanken Group conceptual data models and standards.
Contribute to the development and maintenance of the metadata management system and data dictionaries, working collaboratively with data owners and their teams.
Document source to target technical data lineage and data quality controls along the data flow for reports and business outputs.
Analyse data quality root causes and understand business problems, partnering with business and technology teams to remediate data quality issues.
Build data outcomes using technical data profiling, mining, utilising data analysis skills.
Undertake quantitative analysis using Power BI, Excel and SQL experience to source, analyse, normalise and process data across multiple data sets.
Conduct data analysis to study, analyse and interpret large volumes of transactional data, question authenticity as well as construct solutions.
Interpret data flows and models to understand lineage gaps and resolve missing data quality controls.
Apply best practice data quality and metadata management principles to resolve data quality issues and address underlying causes.
Support the development of trusted sources for critical data, working with other stakeholders including data consumers, data producers, data owners and stewards to define requirements.


Ideal Candidate

Research (by Harvard University) shows that women are particularly likely to second guess themselves and not apply - so if you are worried you don't meet all the criteria, get in touch anyhow and let us do the worrying…


Be passionate about data quality and continuously strive to promote data quality through the development of system and process controls.
Apply technical thinking with regards to analysing complex data sets and extracting meaningful insights for data quality management
Demonstrate detailed scrutiny of technical and business data flows and transformations in order to operationalise data lineage management.
Demonstrate experience leading data management activities to implement data frameworks and establish data controls and monitor their effectiveness.
Experience of leading data quality initiatives that have provided tangible efficiencies and/or business value.
Experience of data quality management, master data management and reference data management
Working knowledge of statutory frameworks such as CCPA, GDPR, BCBS and Data Protection Act
Demonstrate experience of problem-solving skills related to data profiling analysis, score carding and error detection.
Experience using data visualisation tools to present complex analysis is essential e.g. Power BI, Tableau, QlikView
Strong presentation skills both written and oral, experienced in presenting complex data concepts to a business audience i.e. running workshops and formal data governance meetings.
Knowledge and understanding of master data elements and processes, understanding of static versus transactional data challenges.
Experience and/or knowledge of data quality and lineage tools: Ad Initio, Collibra, Informatica, IBM MDM etc.
Experience of data modelling is ideal but not essential.


Company Information

Handelsbanken is a relationship bank with a decentralised way of working, a strong local presence thanks to a nationwide network of branches, and a long-term approach to customer relations. Each Handelsbanken branch operates as a local business enabling it to make decisions at a local level and provide a bespoke service. The focus is always on the need of the individual customer and not on the sale of specific products.

We are embarking on an exciting Business Transformation journey. This transformation will significantly enhance our technology system systems, processes and services, bringing evolution to our ways of working. Join us in this transformative journey, where your dedication, adaptability and commitment will play a crucial role in shaping the future of banking for our valued customers.

The Bank is deeply committed to embedding good equality and diversity practice into all of our activities. This is so that we are an inclusive, welcoming and inspiring place to work that encourages everyone to apply, regardless of socio-economic background, age, disability, pregnancy and/or parental status, race (including colour, nationality, and ethnic or national origin), veteran status, marital and civil partnership status, religion or belief, sex, gender reassignment or sexual orientation.

Check our Handelsbanken website for further information

At Handelsbanken, we deeply value our unique culture and values including trust in and respect for each individual. We take pride in nurturing a work environment where people flourish, and where they are empowered to take decisions in their areas of expertise. We take a long term perspective in everything we do and want each employee who joins us to build a long terms successful career with the Bank.

What is in it for you?


We have a wide range of learning and development available, empowering and enabling our colleagues to take ownership of their own development.
Competitive Salary and an extensive range of benefits is provided, including private medical insurance, income protection and life assurance
A market-leading pension contribution of 15% paid by the bank, which can be invested in a wide range of funds (including ESG and Shariah funds)


Application next steps

Your journey with us begins once you have submitted your application. One of our Handelsbanken recruiters will be reviewing your details and will later organise a phone conversation if you match the role requirements. If there is a mutual fit, we will extend an invitation for you to participate in an interview.

There will be a combination of technical and competency based interviews.

How can we support you to be your best self? Our Talent Acquisition team will be happy to provide support e.g. if you need additional time to prepare for an interview or you have any requirements for any part of the interview/hiring process – just let us know by email uk_talent@careers.handelsbanken.co.uk .

This advert will be live for a minimum of two weeks. However, please note that after the two weeks, the closing date could change at any time depending on the number of responses received.
